render.tex: \title{Matrix Basics} \\ %text A few basic rules regarding matrices %

reason.tex: %text - A matrix is an ordered array of numbers or functions - A matrix having $m$ rows and $n$ columns is called a matrix of order $m\times n$ - If $m=n$ an $m\times n$ matrix is called a \underline\text{square matrix} - Two matrices can only be added if they are of the same order - To add to matrices, simply add their corresponding elements - A \underline\text{diagonal matrix} is a square matrix whose non-diagonal elements $a_{ij}$ when $i\neq j$ are all $0$ - An \underline\text{identity matrix} is a square matrix whose diagonal elements are all $1$. It is usually denoted by $I$ %
